question: Which two countries share the top spot for the "least corrupt country" as per the Transparency International's "Corruption Perception Index, 2019"?
explanation: New Zealand and Denmark share the top spot for the "least corrupt country" as per the Transparency International's "Corruption Perception Index". The 2019 Corruption Perception Index, published in January 2020, currently ranks 180 countries on a scale from 100 (very clean) to 0 (highly corrupt). Denmark, New Zealand and Finland are perceived as the least corrupt nations in the world. Both New Zealand and Denmark got a score of 87 out of 100. South Sudan and Somalia are highly corrupt countries in the world.
